intro: Macrolobium bifolium, commonly known as the two-leaved macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
